smell_analysis.justification: All diagrams in the provided file contain visual elements and content; no empty diagrams were found.
All use cases in the 'Tubade funktsionaalne allsüsteem' diagram (Page 2) are connected to actors or are part of include relationships initiated by connected use cases.
No use cases with synonymous names associated with the same actor were found.
No distinct model elements with duplicate names were found within the same package.
No redundant data columns (denormalization) without foreign keys were detected in the transformed database diagrams.
All use cases follow a consistent naming convention, starting with a verb in the imperative mood (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Lõpeta', 'Registreeri').
In the state diagram (Page 10), all states (including 'Unustatud' and 'Lõpetatud') are reachable from the Start state ('Alg').
All actions in the activity diagram (Page 3) are reachable through the decision flows.
Relationships in the class and database diagrams have defined multiplicity indicators (e.g., '1', '0..*') where required.
The use case diagram 'Tubade funktsionaalne allsüsteem' (Page 2) contains 11 central use case elements (ovals), which exceeds the threshold of 10.

On the 'Tubade register (transformed)' diagram (Page 17), the table 'Tuba' has 7 visual connection lines to other tables (Hoone, Toa_seisundi_liik, Toa_tyyp, Voodi_tyyp, Tootaja (x2), Toa_kategooria_omamine), exceeding the limit of 6.
The layout of elements across all diagrams appears reasonably balanced with no extreme outliers in distance between related elements.
All use case and activity action names start with an active verb (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Otsi', 'Lõpeta').
No class, table, attribute, or use case names with 3 or fewer characters were found (excluding allowed state names or abbreviations like 'id').
Class names begin with an uppercase letter and use singular nouns (e.g., 'Isik', 'Tuba').
Attribute and column names start with a lowercase letter (e.g., 'eesnimi', 'tuba_kood').
Table names in the transformed diagrams are singular (e.g., 'Tuba', 'Isik', 'Riik').
No Hungarian notation or type prefixes (like 'tbl_', 'str') were found in element names.
